summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview of a BOP Correctional Officer from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview was conducted by OIG agents and the officer was represented by an attorney. The document references attached transcripts and prison records from August 2019.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of a BOP Correctional Officer from MCC New York regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The interviewed officer was a Senior Officer Specialist at MCC New York when Epstein was housed there.
The officer was represented by attorney Stacey Richman and legal intern Matthew Fooksman during the interview.
The memorandum references and attaches multiple MCC New York prison records from August 9-10, 2019, related to inmate counts and assignments.
The document states the interview was recorded and transcribed, and the recording was saved separately due to its large file size.
